subject: Politics
title: Color Revolutions
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Color Revolutions.

hook.text: Ukraine's Orange Revolution, Georgia's Rose Revolution â€” citizens used flowers and colors instead of bullets.

buildup.text: Color revolutions are nonviolent mass protests that topple authoritarian governments through people power.

discovery.text: They follow a pattern: stolen elections, mass protests, elite defections, and a negotiated transfer of power.

twist.text: Russia sees color revolutions as Western plots. Putin built his strategy around preventing one at home.

climax.text: Success is fragile. Ukraine's Orange Revolution won but its gains eroded. A second revolution came in 2014.

punchline.text: Color revolutions win without guns. Keeping what they win is harder.

quiz.question: What pattern do color revolutions typically follow?
options: Stolen elections, mass protests, elite defections, and negotiated transitions
Military coups followed by democratic elections
